 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">

        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1345546: Security: Use-After-Free in WebUIBubbleDialogView::ClearContentsWrapper
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1345546: Security: Use-After-Free in WebUIBubbleDialogView::ClearContentsWrapper
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      young...@snu.ac.kr<a id="user-link" href="/u/3767710448" title="young...@snu.ac.kr"><!---->young...@snu.ac.kr<!----></a>
      young...@snu.ac.kr<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->young...@snu.ac.kr<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I found a UAF that has a similar root-cause with 1343686, 1344028.<span class="line"><!---->I found a UAF that has a similar root-cause with 1343686, 1344028.<!----></span><br><br>But I am not sure whether this vulnerability is related to them.<span class="line"><!---->But I am not sure whether this vulnerability is related to them.<!----></span><br><br>Because I can't find other logs like 1343686 or 1344028.<span class="line"><!---->Because I can't find other logs like 1343686 or 1344028.<!----></span><br><br>It is triggered by `BubbleContentsWrapperT<TabSearchUI>::BubbleContentsWrapperT` object.<span class="line"><!---->It is triggered by `BubbleContentsWrapperT&lt;TabSearchUI&gt;::BubbleContentsWrapperT` object.<!----></span><br><br>I will attach the asan log and poc video.<span class="line"><!---->I will attach the asan log and poc video.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 104.0.5107 (win32-release_x64_asan-win32-release_x64-1011400)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 104.0.5107 (win32-release_x64_asan-win32-release_x64-1011400)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.1826)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.1826)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Click "Customize Profile".<span class="line"><!---->1. Click "Customize Profile".<!----></span><br>2. Click theme colors and "Search Tabs".<span class="line"><!---->2. Click theme colors and "Search Tabs".<!----></span><br>3. Close the window.<span class="line"><!---->3. Close the window.<!----></span><br><br>In my opinion, if there is a way to delete the "View" that has a BubbleContentsWrapperT<TabSearchUI>, this vulnerability can be triggered without clicking theme colors.<span class="line"><!---->In my opinion, if there is a way to delete the "View" that has a BubbleContentsWrapperT&lt;TabSearchUI&gt;, this vulnerability can be triggered without clicking theme colors.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL Freed heap region:       fd<span class="line"><!---->  Freed heap region:       fd<!----></span><br>  Stack left redzone:      f1<span class="line"><!---->  Stack left redzone:      f1<!----></span><br>  Stack mid redzone:       f2<span class="line"><!---->  Stack mid redzone:       f2<!----></span><br>  Stack right redzone:     f3<span class="line"><!---->  Stack right redzone:     f3<!----></span><br>  Stack after return:      f5<span class="line"><!---->  Stack after return:      f5<!----></span><br>  Stack use after scope:   f8<span class="line"><!---->  Stack use after scope:   f8<!----></span><br>  Global redzone:          f9<span class="line"><!---->  Global redzone:          f9<!----></span><br>  Global init order:       f6<span class="line"><!---->  Global init order:       f6<!----></span><br>  Poisoned by user:        f7<span class="line"><!---->  Poisoned by user:        f7<!----></span><br>  Container overflow:      fc<span class="line"><!---->  Container overflow:      fc<!----></span><br>  Array cookie:            ac<span class="line"><!---->  Array cookie:            ac<!----></span><br>  Intra object redzone:    bb<span class="line"><!---->  Intra object redzone:    bb<!----></span><br>  ASan internal:           fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:           fe<!----></span><br>  Left alloca redzone:     ca<span class="line"><!---->  Left alloca redzone:     ca<!----></span><br>  Right alloca redzone:    cb<span class="line"><!---->  Right alloca redzone:    cb<!----></span><br>==6740==ABORTING<span class="line"><!---->==6740==ABORTING<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: YoungJoo Lee(@ashuu_lee) of CompSec Lab at Seoul National University<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: YoungJoo Lee(@ashuu_lee) of CompSec Lab at Seoul National University<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          (was: Unconfirmed)

          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          tluk@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-102 Security_Severity-High OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-1
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Bubbles
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I'm not able to repro—probably it depends on a race somewhere. But based on what I've learned about views, this seems like a plausible use-after-free: closing a view has a sync and an async portion (when the view is *really* destroyed), and if the BubbleContentsWrapper is destroyed in the meantime by something else, then this is a use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not able to repro—probably it depends on a race somewhere. But based on what I've learned about views, this seems like a plausible use-after-free: closing a view has a sync and an async portion (when the view is *really* destroyed), and if the BubbleContentsWrapper is destroyed in the meantime by something else, then this is a use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>While the repro is on Windows, I'm guessing this is used on Mac+Linux+CrOS as well. tluk@, please feel free to clear those flags if this analysis is wrong.<span class="line"><!---->While the repro is on Windows, I'm guessing this is used on Mac+Linux+CrOS as well. tluk@, please feel free to clear those flags if this analysis is wrong.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        tluk: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->tluk: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. There are destruction orders that may cause the bubble<span class="line"><!---->bubble. There are destruction orders that may cause the bubble<!----></span><br>manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<span class="line"><!---->manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<!----></span><br>result in UAFs.<span class="line"><!---->result in UAFs.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<!----></span><br>during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<span class="line"><!---->during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<!----></span><br>destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<!----></span><br>persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<span class="line"><!---->persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<!----></span><br>default functionality. This incorrect configuration was causing the<span class="line"><!---->default functionality. This incorrect configuration was causing the<!----></span><br>miss-configured test to fail as the content wrapper service would<span class="line"><!---->miss-configured test to fail as the content wrapper service would<!----></span><br>persist the web contents' native window beyond the lifetime of the<span class="line"><!---->persist the web contents' native window beyond the lifetime of the<!----></span><br>AuraTestHelper's context.<span class="line"><!---->AuraTestHelper's context.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1345546<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         Merge review required: M105 is already shipping to beta.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M105 is already shipping to beta.<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<!----></span><br>1.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/616ca44cb8e7f7c70d53adb443b18fa77bd06030<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/616ca44cb8e7f7c70d53adb443b18fa77bd06030"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/616ca44cb8e7f7c70d53adb443b18fa77bd06030<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>616ca44cb8e7f7c70d53adb443b18fa77bd06030<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/616ca44cb8e7f7c70d53adb443b18fa77bd06030"><!---->616ca44cb8e7f7c70d53adb443b18fa77bd06030<!----></a><br>Author: Tom Lukaszewicz <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Tom Lukaszewicz &lt;<!----></span>tluk@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tluk@chromium.org"><!---->tluk@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Aug 16 18:34:07 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Aug 16 18:34:07 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M105 Merge][webui bubble] Fix UAF during manager teardown<span class="line"><!---->[M105 Merge][webui bubble] Fix UAF during manager teardown<!----></span><br><br>The WebUIBubbleManager manages and provides resources to a WebUI<span class="line"><!---->The WebUIBubbleManager manages and provides resources to a WebUI<!----></span><br>bubble. There are destruction orders that may cause the bubble<span class="line"><!---->bubble. There are destruction orders that may cause the bubble<!----></span><br>manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<span class="line"><!---->manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<!----></span><br>result in UAFs.<span class="line"><!---->result in UAFs.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<!----></span><br>during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<span class="line"><!---->during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<!----></span><br>destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<!----></span><br>persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<span class="line"><!---->persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<!----></span><br>default functionality. This incorrect configuration was causing the<span class="line"><!---->default functionality. This incorrect configuration was causing the<!----></span><br>miss-configured test to fail as the content wrapper service would<span class="line"><!---->miss-configured test to fail as the content wrapper service would<!----></span><br>persist the web contents' native window beyond the lifetime of the<span class="line"><!---->persist the web contents' native window beyond the lifetime of the<!----></span><br>AuraTestHelper's context.<span class="line"><!---->AuraTestHelper's context.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f41f21970277ff01c4286c8884b585a0cfbde578<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f41f21970277ff01c4286c8884b585a0cfbde578"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f41f21970277ff01c4286c8884b585a0cfbde578<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f41f21970277ff01c4286c8884b585a0cfbde578<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f41f21970277ff01c4286c8884b585a0cfbde578"><!---->f41f21970277ff01c4286c8884b585a0cfbde578<!----></a><br>Author: Tom Lukaszewicz <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Tom Lukaszewicz &lt;<!----></span>tluk@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tluk@chromium.org"><!---->tluk@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Sep 13 13:33:28 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Sep 13 13:33:28 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M96-LTS][webui bubble] Fix UAF during manager teardown<span class="line"><!---->[M96-LTS][webui bubble] Fix UAF during manager teardown<!----></span><br><br>The WebUIBubbleManager manages and provides resources to a WebUI<span class="line"><!---->The WebUIBubbleManager manages and provides resources to a WebUI<!----></span><br>bubble. There are destruction orders that may cause the bubble<span class="line"><!---->bubble. There are destruction orders that may cause the bubble<!----></span><br>manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<span class="line"><!---->manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<!----></span><br>result in UAFs.<span class="line"><!---->result in UAFs.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<!----></span><br>during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<span class="line"><!---->during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<!----></span><br>destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<!----></span><br>persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<span class="line"><!---->persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<!----></span><br>default functionality. This incorrect configuration was causing the<span class="line"><!---->default functionality. This incorrect configuration was causing the<!----></span><br>miss-configured test to fail as the content wrapper service would<span class="line"><!---->miss-configured test to fail as the content wrapper service would<!----></span><br>persist the web contents' native window beyond the lifetime of the<span class="line"><!---->persist the web contents' native window beyond the lifetime of There are destruction orders that may cause the bubble<!----></span><br>manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<span class="line"><!---->manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<!----></span><br>result in UAFs.<span class="line"><!---->result in UAFs.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<!----></span><br>during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<span class="line"><!---->during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<!----></span><br>destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<!----></span><br>persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<span class="line"><!---->persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<!----></span><br>default functionality.       <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);

<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

      z-index: 8675309; /* Jenny */

      opacity: .75;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

            Close
          </button>
        </h2>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

          }

          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I found a UAF that has a similar root-cause with 1343686, 1344028.<span class="line"><!---->I found a UAF that has a similar root-cause with 1343686, 1344028.<!----></span><br><br>But I am not sure whether this vulnerability is related to them.<span class="line"><!---->But I am not sure whether this vulnerability is related to them.<!----></span><br><br>Because I can't find other logs like 1343686 or 1344028.<span class="line"><!---->Because I can't find other logs like 1343686 or 1344028.<!----></span><br><br>It is triggered by `BubbleContentsWrapperT<TabSearchUI>::BubbleContentsWrapperT` object.<span class="line"><!---->It is triggered by `BubbleContentsWrapperT&lt;TabSearchUI&gt;::BubbleContentsWrapperT` object.<!----></span><br><br>I will attach the asan log and poc video.<span class="line"><!---->I will attach the asan log and poc video.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 104.0.5107 (win32-release_x64_asan-win32-release_x64-1011400)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 104.0.5107 (win32-release_x64_asan-win32-release_x64-1011400)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.1826)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.1826)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Click "Customize Profile".<span class="line"><!---->1. Click "Customize Profile".<!----></span><br>2. Click theme colors and "Search Tabs".<span class="line"><!---->2. Click theme colors and "Search Tabs".<!----></span><br>3. Close the window.<span class="line"><!---->3. Close the window.<!----></span><br><br>In my opinion, if there is a way to delete the "View" that has a BubbleContentsWrapperT<TabSearchUI>, this vulnerability can be triggered without clicking theme colors.<span class="line"><!---->In my opinion, if there is a way to delete the "View" that has a BubbleContentsWrapperT&lt;TabSearchUI&gt;, this vulnerability can be triggered without clicking theme colors.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1345546#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1345546#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jul 19, 2022, 3:40 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          tluk@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-102 Security_Severity-High OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-1
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>Bubbles
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          tluk@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-102 Security_Severity-High OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-1
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Bubbles
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I'm not able to repro—probably it depends on a race somewhere. But based on what I've learned about views, this seems like a plausible use-after-free: closing a view has a sync and an async portion (when the view is *really* destroyed), and if the BubbleContentsWrapper is destroyed in the meantime by something else, then this is a use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not able to repro—probably it depends on a race somewhere. But based on what I've learned about views, this seems like a plausible use-after-free: closing a view has a sync and an async portion (when the view is *really* destroyed), and if the BubbleContentsWrapper is destroyed in the meantime by something else, then this is a use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>While the repro is on Windows, I'm guessing this is used on Mac+Linux+CrOS as well. tluk@, please feel free to clear those flags if this analysis is wrong.<span class="line"><!---->While the repro is on Windows, I'm guessing this is used on Mac+Linux+CrOS as well. tluk@, please feel free to clear those flags if this analysis is wrong.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8608c31f253cbbf56988afa78d3b530106146f3e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8608c31f253cbbf56988afa78d3b530106146f3e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8608c31f253cbbf56988afa78d3b530106146f3e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8608c31f253cbbf56988afa78d3b530106146f3e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8608c31f253cbbf56988afa78d3b530106146f3e"><!---->8608c31f253cbbf56988afa78d3b530106146f3e<!----></a><br>Author: Tom Lukaszewicz <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Tom Lukaszewicz &lt;<!----></span>tluk@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tluk@chromium.org"><!---->tluk@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Aug 05 23:04:37 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Aug 05 23:04:37 2022<!----></span><br><br>[webui bubble] Fix UAF during manager teardown<span class="line"><!---->[webui bubble] Fix UAF during manager teardown<!----></span><br><br>The WebUIBubbleManager manages and provides resources to a WebUI<span class="line"><!---->The WebUIBubbleManager manages and provides resources to a WebUI<!----></span><br>bubble. There are destruction orders that may cause the bubble<span class="line"><!---->bubble. There are destruction orders that may cause the bubble<!----></span><br>manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<span class="line"><!---->manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<!----></span><br>result in UAFs.<span class="line"><!---->result in UAFs.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<!----></span><br>during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<span class="line"><!---->during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<!----></span><br>destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<!----></span><br>persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<span class="line"><!---->persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<!----></span><br>default functionality. This incorrect configuration was causing the<span class="line"><!---->default functionality. This incorrect configuration was causing the<!----></span><br>miss-configured test to fail as the content wrapper service would<span class="line"><!---->miss-configured test to fail as the content wrapper service would<!----></span><br>persist the web contents' native window beyond the lifetime of the<span class="line"><!---->persist the web contents' native window beyond the lifetime of the<!----></span><br>AuraTestHelper's context.<span class="line"><!---->AuraTestHelper's context.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1345546<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

There are destruction orders that may cause the bubble<span class="line"><!---->bubble. There are destruction orders that may cause the bubble<!----></span><br>manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<span class="line"><!---->manager to be destroyed before its bubble, which can potentially<!----></span><br>result in UAFs.<span class="line"><!---->result in UAFs.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that the managed bubble is synchronously closed<!----></span><br>during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<span class="line"><!---->during destruction of the manager if it has not already been<!----></span><br>destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also fixes a broken browsertest that was written with the<!----></span><br>persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<span class="line"><!---->persistent renderer flag enabled - but was intending to test the<!----></span><br>default functionality. This incorrect configuration was causing the<span class="line"><!---->default functionality. This incorrect configuration was causing the<!----></span><br>miss-configured test to fail as the content wrapper service would<span class="line"><!---->miss-configured test to fail as the content wrapper service would<!----></span><br>persist the web contents' native window beyond the lifetime of the<span class="line"><!---->persist the web contents' native window beyond the lifetime of            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
